metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: AppML PHP
If you have access to a PHP server, follow the instructions below to create an AppML server application.
content.html: If you have access to a PHP server, follow the instructions below to create an AppML server application.

content.text: Create a Test Page
Create a test page and save on your PHP server as customers.htm (or anything you like):
content.html: Create a test page and save on your PHP server as customers.htm (or anything you like):

Customers

                               
CustomerCityCountry
{{CustomerName}}{{City}} {{Country}}

syntax_highlighting.text:
var customers = {"records":[{"CustomerName":"Alfreds Futterkiste","City":"Berlin","Country":"Germany"},
    {"CustomerName":"Ana Trujillo Emparedados y helados","City":"México D.F.","Country":"Mexico"},
    {"CustomerName":"Antonio Moreno Taquería","City":"México D.F.","Country":"Mexico"},
    {"CustomerName":"Around the Horn","City":"London","Country":"UK"},{"CustomerName":"B's 
    Beverages","City":"London","Country":"UK"},{"CustomerName":"Berglunds 
    snabbköp","City":"Luleå","Country":"Sweden"},{"CustomerName":"Blauer See 
    Delikatessen","City":"Mannheim","Country":"Germany"},{"CustomerName":"Blondel 
    père et fils","City":"Strasbourg","Country":"France"},{"CustomerName":"Bólido 
    Comidas preparadas","City":"Madrid","Country":"Spain"},{"CustomerName":"Bon 
    app'","City":"Marseille","Country":"France"},{"CustomerName":"Bottom-Dollar 
    Marketse","City":"Tsawassen","Country":"Canada"},{"CustomerName":"Cactus 
    Comidas para llevar","City":"Buenos Aires","Country":"Argentina"},{"CustomerName":"Centro 
    comercial Moctezuma","City":"México D.F.","Country":"Mexico"},{"CustomerName":"Chop-suey 
    Chinese","City":"Bern","Country":"Switzerland"},{"CustomerName":"Comércio 
    Mineiro","City":"São Paulo","Country":"Brazil"}]};

content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
<title>Customers</title>
<link rel="stylesheet" href="https://www.w3schools.com/w3css/4/w3.css">
<script src="https://www.w3schools.com/appml/2.0.3/appml.js"></script>
</head>
<body>

<div class="w3-container" appml-data="customers">
<h1>Customers</h1>
<table class="w3-table-all">
  <tr>
    <th>Customer</th>
    <th>City</th>
    <th>Country</th>
  </tr>
  <tr appml-repeat="records">
    <td>{{CustomerName}}</td>
    <td>{{City}} </td>
    <td>{{Country}} </td>
  </tr>
</table>
</div>

<script>
var customers = {
"records":[
{"CustomerName":"Alfreds Futterkiste","City":"Berlin","Country":"Germany"},
{"CustomerName":"Ana Trujillo Emparedados y helados","City":"México D.F.","Country":"Mexico"},
{"CustomerName":"Antonio Moreno Taquería","City":"México D.F.","Country":"Mexico"},
{"CustomerName":"Around the Horn","City":"London","Country":"UK"},
{"CustomerName":"B's Beverages","City":"London","Country":"UK"},
{"CustomerName":"Berglunds snabbköp","City":"Luleå","Country":"Sweden"},
{"CustomerName":"Blauer See Delikatessen","City":"Mannheim","Country":"Germany"},
{"CustomerName":"Blondel père et fils","City":"Strasbourg","Country":"France"},
{"CustomerName":"Bólido Comidas preparadas","City":"Madrid","Country":"Spain"},
{"CustomerName":"Bon app'","City":"Marseille","Country":"France"},
{"CustomerName":"Bottom-Dollar Marketse","City":"Tsawassen","Country":"Canada"},
{"CustomerName":"Cactus Comidas para llevar","City":"Buenos Aires","Country":"Argentina"},
{"CustomerName":"Centro comercial Moctezuma","City":"México D.F.","Country":"Mexico"},
{"CustomerName":"Chop-suey Chinese","City":"Bern","Country":"Switzerland"},
{"CustomerName":"Comércio Mineiro","City":"São Paulo","Country":"Brazil"}
]};
</script>

</body>
</html>

content.text: Test the web page in your browser.
content.html: Test the web page in your browser.

content.text: Create a Database Connection
If you have access to a Database, follow the instructions below to create an AppML database connection.
content.html: If you have access to a Database, follow the instructions below to create an AppML database connection.

content.text: Define a database connection, and save it on the server as appml_config.php :
content.html: Define a database connection, and save it on the server as appml_config.php:

content.code_html:
<?php echo("Access Forbidden");exit();?>
{
"dateformat" : "yyyy-mm-dd",
"databases" : [{
    "connection" : "mydatabase",
    "host" : "localhost",
    "dbname" : "DemoDB",
    "username" : "DemoDBUkbn5",
    "password" : "l6|U6=V(*T+P"
}]
}

content.text: The connection above is not real. Names and passwords are examples.
content.html: The connection above is not real. Names and passwords are examples.

content.text: Configuration File Explained:
Copy AppML
Download the file: https://www.w3schools.com/appml/2.0.3/appml.php.txt .
Copy the file to your web site. Rename it to appml.php .
content.html: Copy the file to your web site. Rename it to appml.php.

content.text: Create a Database Table
Create a model for creating a Customers table in the database. Save it as create_customers.js :
content.html: Create a model for creating a Customers table in the database. Save it as create_customers.js:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
{"database" : {"connection" : "mydatabase","execute" : ["DROP 
 TABLE IF EXISTS Customers","CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS Customers (CustomerID 
 INTEGER NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,(CustomerID),CustomerName NVARCHAR(255),ContactName NVARCHAR(255),Address NVARCHAR(255),City 
 NVARCHAR(255),PostalCode NVARCHAR(255),Country NVARCHAR(255))",
"INSERT INTO Customers(CustomerName,ContactName,Address,City,PostalCode,Country)VALUES (\"Alfreds Futterkiste\",\"Maria Anders\",\"Obere Str. 
 57\",\"Berlin\",\"12209\",\"Germany\")","INSERT INTO Customers(CustomerName,ContactName,Address,City,PostalCode,Country)VALUES (\"Around the Horn\",\"Thomas Hardy\",\"120 Hanover 
 Sq.\",\"London\",\"WA1 1DP\",\"UK\")","INSERT INTO Customers(CustomerName,ContactName,Address,City,PostalCode,Country)VALUES (\"Blauer See Delikatessen\",\"Hanna Moos\",\"Forsterstr. 
 57\",\"Mannheim\",\"68306\",\"Germany\")"]}}

"CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS Customers (CustomerID 
 INTEGER NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,(CustomerID),CustomerName NVARCHAR(255),ContactName NVARCHAR(255),Address NVARCHAR(255),City 
 NVARCHAR(255),PostalCode NVARCHAR(255),Country NVARCHAR(255))"

"INSERT INTO Customers(CustomerName,ContactName,Address,City,PostalCode,Country)VALUES (\"Around the Horn\",\"Thomas Hardy\",\"120 Hanover 
 Sq.\",\"London\",\"WA1 1DP\",\"UK\")"

]

content.text: Create an HTML page for running the create_customers.js model:
content.html: Create an HTML page for running the create_customers.js model:

content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<script src="https://www.w3schools.com/appml/2.0.3/appml.js"></script>
<body>

<div appml-data="appml.php?model=create_customers"></div>

</body>
</html>

content.text: Run the HTML page in your browser.
content.html: Run the HTML page in your browser.

content.text: Create an Application Model
Create a model for the customers application. Save it as model_customers.js :
content.html: Create a model for the customers application. Save it as model_customers.js:

content.code_html:
{
"rowsperpage" : 10,
"database" : {
    "connection" : "mydatabase",
    "sql" : "SELECT * FROM Customers",
    "orderby" : "CustomerName"
}
}

content.text: Create an HTML page for running the customers application:
content.html: Create an HTML page for running the customers application:

content.code:
Customers

                               
CustomerCityCountry
{{CustomerName}}{{City}}{{Country}}
content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<title>Customers</title>
<link rel="stylesheet" href="https://www.w3schools.com/w3css/4/w3.css">
<script src="https://www.w3schools.com/appml/2.0.3/appml.js"></script>
<body>

<div class="w3-container" appml-data="appml.php?model=model_customers">
<h1>Customers</h1>
<table class="w3-table-all">
  <tr>
    <th>Customer</th>
    <th>City</th>
    <th>Country</th>
  </tr>
  <tr appml-repeat="records">
    <td>{{CustomerName}}</td>
    <td>{{City}}</td>
    <td>{{Country}}</td>
  </tr>
</table>
</div>

</body>
</html>

content.text: Run the HTML in your browser.
